subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Bernhard Langer birdied his first two holes, then avoided the mistakes that plagued his closest rivals in the Champions Tour’s Ginn Championship in Palm Coast, Fla. Langer, a two-time Masters champion, was one of only two players who did not have a bogey on the windy Oceanside course. He shot a six-under-par 66 to reach 11-under 133 after two rounds, moving two strokes ahead of Lonnie Nielsen (69).
